001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Num;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.Map;
014import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
015
016public class KalmanFilterLatencyCompensator<S extends Num, I extends Num, O extends Num> {
017  private static final int kMaxPastObserverStates = 300;
018
019  private final List<Map.Entry<Double, ObserverSnapshot>> m_pastObserverSnapshots;
020
021  KalmanFilterLatencyCompensator() {
022    m_pastObserverSnapshots = new ArrayList<>();
023  }
024
025  /** Clears the observer snapshot buffer. */
026  public void reset() {
027    m_pastObserverSnapshots.clear();
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * Add past observer states to the observer snapshots list.
032   *
033   * @param observer The observer.
034   * @param u The input at the timestamp.
035   * @param localY The local output at the timestamp
036   * @param timestampSeconds The timesnap of the state.
037   */
038  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
039  public void addObserverState(
040      KalmanTypeFilter<S, I, O> observer,
041      Matrix<I, N1> u,
042      Matrix<O, N1> localY,
043      double timestampSeconds) {
044    m_pastObserverSnapshots.add(
045        Map.entry(timestampSeconds, new ObserverSnapshot(observer, u, localY)));
046
047    if (m_pastObserverSnapshots.size() > kMaxPastObserverStates) {
048      m_pastObserverSnapshots.remove(0);
049    }
050  }
051
052  /**
053   * Add past global measurements (such as from vision)to the estimator.
054   *
055   * @param <R> The rows in the global measurement vector.
056   * @param rows The rows in the global measurement vector.
057   * @param observer The observer to apply the past global measurement.
058   * @param nominalDtSeconds The nominal timestep.
059   * @param y The measurement.
060   * @param globalMeasurementCorrect The function take calls correct() on the observer.
061   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the measurement.
062   */
063  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
064  public <R extends Num> void applyPastGlobalMeasurement(
065      Nat<R> rows,
066      KalmanTypeFilter<S, I, O> observer,
067      double nominalDtSeconds,
068      Matrix<R, N1> y,
069      BiConsumer<Matrix<I, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> globalMeasurementCorrect,
070      double timestampSeconds) {
071    if (m_pastObserverSnapshots.isEmpty()) {
072      // State map was empty, which means that we got a past measurement right at startup. The only
073      // thing we can really do is ignore the measurement.
074      return;
075    }
076
077    // Use a less verbose name for timestamp
078    double timestamp = timestampSeconds;
079
080    int maxIdx = m_pastObserverSnapshots.size() - 1;
081    int low = 0;
082    int high = maxIdx;
083
084    // Perform a binary search to find the index of first snapshot whose
085    // timestamp is greater than or equal to the global measurement timestamp
086    while (low != high) {
087      int mid = (low + high) / 2;
088      if (m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(mid).getKey() < timestamp) {
089        // This index and everything under it are less than the requested timestamp. Therefore, we
090        // can discard them.
091        low = mid + 1;
092      } else {
093        // t is at least as large as the element at this index. This means that anything after it
094        // cannot be what we are looking for.
095        high = mid;
096      }
097    }
098
099    int indexOfClosestEntry;
100
101    if (low == 0) {
102      // If the global measurement is older than any snapshot, throw out the
103      // measurement because there's no state estimate into which to incorporate
104      // the measurement
105      if (timestamp < m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(low).getKey()) {
106        return;
107      }
108
109      // If the first snapshot has same timestamp as the global measurement, use
110      // that snapshot
111      indexOfClosestEntry = 0;
112    } else if (low == maxIdx && m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(low).getKey() < timestamp) {
113      // If all snapshots are older than the global measurement, use the newest
114      // snapshot
115      indexOfClosestEntry = maxIdx;
116    } else {
117      // Index of snapshot taken after the global measurement
118      int nextIdx = low;
119
120      // Index of snapshot taken before the global measurement. Since we already
121      // handled the case where the index points to the first snapshot, this
122      // computation is guaranteed to be nonnegative.
123      int prevIdx = nextIdx - 1;
124
125      // Find the snapshot closest in time to global measurement
126      double prevTimeDiff = Math.abs(timestamp - m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(prevIdx).getKey());
127      double nextTimeDiff = Math.abs(timestamp - m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(nextIdx).getKey());
128      indexOfClosestEntry = prevTimeDiff <= nextTimeDiff ? prevIdx : nextIdx;
129    }
130
131    double lastTimestamp =
132        m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(indexOfClosestEntry).getKey() - nominalDtSeconds;
133
134    // We will now go back in time to the state of the system at the time when
135    // the measurement was captured. We will reset the observer to that state,
136    // and apply correction based on the measurement. Then, we will go back
137    // through all observer states until the present and apply past inputs to
138    // get the present estimated state.
139    for (int i = indexOfClosestEntry; i < m_pastObserverSnapshots.size(); i++) {
140      var key = m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(i).getKey();
141      var snapshot = m_pastObserverSnapshots.get(i).getValue();
142
143      if (i == indexOfClosestEntry) {
144        observer.setP(snapshot.errorCovariances);
145        observer.setXhat(snapshot.xHat);
146      }
147
148      observer.predict(snapshot.inputs, key - lastTimestamp);
149      observer.correct(snapshot.inputs, snapshot.localMeasurements);
150
151      if (i == indexOfClosestEntry) {
152        // Note that the measurement is at a timestep close but probably not exactly equal to the
153        // timestep for which we called predict.
154        // This makes the assumption that the dt is small enough that the difference between the
155        // measurement time and the time that the inputs were captured at is very small.
156        globalMeasurementCorrect.accept(snapshot.inputs, y);
157      }
158      lastTimestamp = key;
159
160      m_pastObserverSnapshots.set(
161          i,
162          Map.entry(
163              key, new ObserverSnapshot(observer, snapshot.inputs, snapshot.localMeasurements)));
164    }
165  }
166
167  /** This class contains all the information about our observer at a given time. */
168  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
169  public class ObserverSnapshot {
170    public final Matrix<S, N1> xHat;
171    public final Matrix<S, S> errorCovariances;
172    public final Matrix<I, N1> inputs;
173    public final Matrix<O, N1> localMeasurements;
174
175    @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
176    private ObserverSnapshot(
177        KalmanTypeFilter<S, I, O> observer, Matrix<I, N1> u, Matrix<O, N1> localY) {
178      this.xHat = observer.getXhat();
179      this.errorCovariances = observer.getP();
180
181      inputs = u;
182      localMeasurements = localY;
183    }
184  }
185}
